titleStmt.title: Truth in two letters by a man worth from the regiment of Colonell Browne, upon the designes of, Marblorovv [sic] and VVinchester. With the manner of all the proceedings since they went out upon that service. Not written by any pot poet. But by an honest true hearted citizen, who serves more in conscience then covetousnesse.
titleStmt.author: W. N.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by One, who regards rather truth then money,

notesStmt.note: First letter dated Newbury, December 9. 1642 and signed W. N., second letter dated December 17. 1642.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
